result.execSummary:
The defendant Traevon Young was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Lewd, Lascivious Behavior-Exposure, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber privileges for work and/or school. No electronic monitoring.

**12-17-15/ Judge Ellen R Brostrom**
The Court ordered The JOC amended to reflect that the Probation term is commuted to one (1) year. 

 To be monitored by Department of Corrections Mental Health Unit.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges or civil judgment will be entered with tax intercept. 
Court WAIVED all permissible costs, fees and surcharges due to financial instability.

-Obtain GED/HSED;
-Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.
No contact with Bayshore Mall without prior court/agent approval. Any violation may result in additional charges.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Traevon Young

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Reflects 12-17-15 Court order commuting Probation term to 1 year
ORDER COMMUTING PROBATION TERM, signed and filed. lms
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Ellen R. Brostrom, Br. 6, for review. mag
DOC request to clarify length of probation term.

Defendant Traevon Young in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Statements made as to sentencing.
Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 205 days time served.  Huber privileges for work and/or school.   No electronic monitoring.   COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 MONTHS.  To be monitored by Dept. of Corrections Mental Health Unit.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Sex offender assessment and follow through with recommended programming.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* No contact with Bayshore Mallwithout prior court/agent approval.  Any violation may result in additional charges.	
* Obtain GED/HSED.
* Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.
* Defendant to pay all MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges, or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered with tax intercept.  Court WAIVED all permissable costs, fees and surcharges due to financial instability.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs. 

 Filed,
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;

Defendant Traevon Young in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Traevon Young in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for plea hearing.
State placed plea negotiations on the record.

AS TO COUNT 1:

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 6.  Court ordered that defendant be picked up by JusticePoint Program either today or tomorrow morning.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt: Oral No Contact Order with Bayshore Mall.

State is requesting a PR bond with Turnover to JusticePoint and no contact with Bayshore Mall.  Defense does not object to State's request.

Court orders $1,000.00 PR bond with turnover to JusticePoint with enhance supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.

Defendant Traevon Young in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Traevon Young in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings.  Court finds the defendant does appreciate the taking of medication.  Court does not order involuntary medications.  Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.  Arguments heard as to bail.

Defense request a plea date.  Case is adjourned for a PLEA in branch 6.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed, from Neil J. Brahmbhatt, D.O., State of Wisconsin Department of Health Services.  lms
ORDER TO PRODUCE   RECEIVED AND FILED.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Traevon Young not in court, in custody.  Defendant appears by video from Mendota Mental Health Institute. 
Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Doctor's Report Return/Review as to competency.  Hearing proceeded.  Defense, defendant, and the state in agreement with report dated 9-17-15.  The Court adopts conclusions of said report opining that the defendant remains incompetent, but likely to regain with continued course of treatment.  Case adjourned for review before Branch 06.  Defendant to appear via video.  Review hearing scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
from Neil J. Brahmbhatt, D.O., received and filed. lms
Per email from videographer, there is a slight conflict the with time of 8:30am.  Case will be heard at 10:30am on 9/29/2015.  Parties notified.  lms

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Traevon ` Young in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Traevon ` Young in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Jesica Ballenger.
Pursuant to Sec. 971.14(4)(a), Wisconsin Statutes, copies of the doctor's report are forwarded to Assistant District Attorney Jesica Ballenger and to the defendant's Attorney, Mark Dluzak.
Defendant does not contest doctor's report.  Parties stipulate to doctor's report.  Court finds defendant is not competent but likely to regain competency and ordered proceedings suspended and defendant committed to the Department of Health Services with credit for 46 days time served. 
Court ordered defendant remanded into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office.
Filed, signed Order for Commitment for Treatment.
Case is adjourned for return on doctor's report in Branch 6.
All parties are notified that effective August  3, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Ellen Brostrom, Branch 6,  in Room 423 of the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Traevon E Young not in court, in custody.   Chris Liegel and Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pursuant to Sec. 971.14(4)(a), Wisconsin Statutes, copies of the doctor's report are forwarded to Assistant District Attorney Jesica Ballenger and to the defendant's Attorney, Mark Dluzak.

Defendant Traevon E Young in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Traevon E Young in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
